feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued February 09 at 5:57AM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area in the Southern Inner Channels, Ketchikan near Ward Lake. * WHEN...Until 900 AM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 09 at 5:35AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong gusty winds and blowing snow in Homer today... Southwest winds of 15 to 30 mph with gusts of 30 to 40 mph will develop in Homer and vicinity during the mid to late morning hours, then persist through the afternoon hours. This will result in areas of blowing and drifting snow, with localized low visibilities. Also expect some snow showers to develop over the

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued February 09 at 5:31AM AKST until February 10 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 09 at 4:46AM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Wind gusts up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Klondike Highway near White Pass. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Wednesday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 09 at 4:29AM AKST until February 09 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches are expected. Blowing snow will cause reduced visibilities to one half mile or less along highway summits. Plan on difficult travel conditions.
